lead_paragraph: RUSSELL--Robert "Bob" L.,son of the late John Andrew Russell and Olivia Isabelle (Tinsley) Russell, devoted historian of American History and advocate for the arts and culture, died Wednesday, June 8, 2016. He was 89 years old. Following graduation from Forest Park High School in Baltimore, Maryland in 1945, Bob joined the US Navy earning a Fleet appointment to the US Naval Academy. From Annapolis, he went to Trinity College, Hartford, Connecticut, where he majored in Modern European History, graduated with honors, and received a Fellowship from Trinity for graduate studies at Yale University, receiving his Master of Arts Degree in 1954. Twenty-six years of his business life were spent at Bankers Trust New York Corporation in charge of Corporate Human Resources. Bob leaves his cherished living relative John (Buddy) Cefalu (Helyne), the Mandel family and many friends. A memorial gathering to celebrate Bob's life will take place on Saturday, September 10 from 2pm to 4pm at 1515 Holicong Road, Buckingham, PA. Gifts in Bob's memory may be made to the James A. Michener Art Museum, 138 South Pine Street, Doylestown, Pennsylvania, Attn: Laurie McGahey. Leaver/Cable of Buckingham, PA. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  RUSSELL, ROBERT "BOB" L.
